detailed_results.input: The industrial system can guarantee that a critical failure will never occur.
The autonomous vehicle can guarantee that sooner or later it will reach the destination.
The industrial system and the operator together can guarantee that sooner or later production will be restored.
The satellite and the ground station together can guarantee that sooner or later the data will be downloaded.
The robot number 3 has a strategy to guarantee that they will reach position 2 in the next step.

The Romans, in the countries which they annexed, observed closely these measures; they sent colonies and maintained friendly relations with the minor powers, without increasing their strength; they kept down the greater, and did not allow any strong foreign powers to gain authority.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold states that the Romans can guarantee globally (G) a conjunction of actions/conditions: sending colonies, maintaining friendly relations with minor powers, and keeping down the greater powers. The prediction instead asserts eventually annex (F annex) and globally keep_down (G keep_down), omitting key conjuncts (send-colony, friendly_with_minor_powers) and changing the temporal structure by adding an eventuality about annexation not present in the gold.

detailed_results.input: The network system can guarantee that critical packet loss will never occur.
The robot number 3 has a strategy to force that eventually position 2 holds and never position 4 afterwards.
The system and the controller together can guarantee that sooner or later consumption will be reduced.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition mismatch: gold requires <<ClimateSystem,Controller>> but prediction uses <<ControlSystem,Controller>>. Even if similar-sounding, the agent set is different, changing who has the ability.

detailed_results.input: Given three robots, none of them has a strategy to ensure that whenever position 2 holds, position 1 will hold in the next step.
detailed_results.gold: !<<Robot1>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot2>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot3>> G (pos2 -> X pos1)
detailed_results.reasoning: The input/gold states that none of the three robots can ensure the property, i.e., it negates the strategic ability for Robot1, Robot2, and Robot3 and conjoins them. The prediction instead asserts that Robot1 can ensure it (missing negation) and omits Robot2 and Robot3 entirely.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that if a stop is requested, then at the next step it will stop moving.
The system and the administrator together can guarantee that sooner or later security will be restored.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition matches the natural-language agents (system+administrator) with only naming variation, and the temporal operator F correctly captures 'sooner or later'; proposition security_restored is unchanged.

detailed_results.input: The climate control system can guarantee that sooner or later the temperature will return to a stable state.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (climate control system) and same temporal operator F expressing eventuality; predicate is a clear alias of 'temperature_stable'.

detailed_results.input: The Parties agree that an armed attack against one or more of them in Europe or North America shall be considered an attack against them all and consequently they agree that, if such an armed attack occurs, each of them, in exercise of the right of individual or collective self-defence recognised by Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations, will assist the Party or Parties so attacked by taking forthwith, individually and in concert with the other Parties, such action as it deems necessary, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain the security of the North Atlantic area.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold is an until formula: <<Parties>>(attack U security_restored), meaning the coalition can ensure security_restored eventually and that attack holds up to that point. Prediction instead is a global implication with an R operator: <<Parties>>G (armed_attack -> R security_restored). This changes both the temporal structure (G with R vs U) and the condition (implication triggered by armed_attack rather than an until over attack), so it is not semantically equivalent.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to guarantee that it will keep position 1 until move is true and while not attack.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires Robot1 to maintain pos1 until a state where move is true and attack is false (move && !attack). Prediction instead targets reaching (pos2 || attack), changing both the condition (move/!attack vs pos2/attack) and polarity (allows attack rather than requiring !attack), so the meaning is not preserved.

detailed_results.input: The satellite can guarantee that sooner or later it will establish a link with the ground station.
The machine can guarantee that if the payment does not occur, the ticket will never be printed.
The robotic arm can guarantee that if the object is grasped, then at the next step it will start transport.
The autonomous vehicle can guarantee that it will never exceed the speed limit.
The control system can guarantee that it will keep regulating until the error becomes zero.
The rover can guarantee that when it is ready to sample, at the next step it will start sampling.
The mobile robot can guarantee that sooner or later it will reach the charging station.
The system and the operators together can guarantee that sooner or later the area will be secured.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition/agent set does not match: gold is <<EmergencySystem,Operators>> while prediction is <<System,Operator>>. Even if similar-sounding, the agents are different, so the ability is attributed to a different coalition.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 1 and number 2 together have a strategy to ensure in the next step not position 5 and not position 4.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires that in the next step both pos5 and pos4 are false (!pos5 && !pos4). Prediction instead requires that in the next step at least one of pos4 or pos5 is true (pos4 || pos5), which is not equivalent and in fact contradicts the intended negations.

detailed_results.input: The satellite can guarantee that it will keep adjusting attitude until the antenna is aligned.
Robots number 1 and number 2 have a joint strategy to always avoid position 3.
The robot number 3 has a strategy to ensure that eventually position 2 holds and then in the next step position 1 holds.
The coalition of robots 2 and 3 has a strategy to ensure that eventually either attack or defend holds and not retreat.
detailed_results.reasoning: The gold requires that eventually (attack or defend) holds AND retreat does not hold: F(((attack || defend) && !retreat)). The prediction omits the !retreat conjunct, so it allows eventual attack/defend even when retreat is true, weakening the property.

detailed_results.input: The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me.
detailed_results.reasoning: Both formulas state that the Lord has a strategy to eventually achieve fulfillment; 'purpose_fulfilled' is a direct predicate alias of 'fulfilled' in this context, and the coalition and F operator match.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 2 and number 3 have a strategy to guarantee that they will eventually reach position 1 and eventually reach position 2.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires both eventualities independently: F pos1 and F pos2 (order irrelevant). Prediction requires eventually reaching pos1 at a time after which pos2 will still eventually be reached (F(pos1 && F pos2)), which is stronger and not equivalent.

detailed_results.input: The robotic arm can guarantee that if it detects a collision, then at the next step it will stop.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Arm) and same temporal structure G( collision_detected -> X ... ). Predicate 'stop' is a clear alias of 'stopped' in this context, preserving meaning.

detailed_results.input: The recommender system can guarantee that it will keep learning until accuracy improves.
The robotic arm can guarantee that it will keep moving toward the target until it reaches it.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires the arm to keep moving toward the target until at_target holds: (moving_to_target U at_target). Prediction uses (moving U at_target), which is a different predicate and does not capture the specific 'toward the target' condition; it weakens/changes the stated property.

detailed_results.input: The drone can guarantee that if it loses GPS signal, then at the next step it will switch to inertial navigation.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Drone) and same temporal structure G( -> X ). The predicate inertial_navigating is a clear alias of inertial_nav_on (switching to inertial navigation at the next step).

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that at the next step the ticket will be validated.
The machine can guarantee that if the ticket is printed, then sooner or later it will be validated.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Machine) and same temporal structure G( -> F ). The predicate 'ticket_validated' is a clear alias of 'validated' in the context of ticket validation, so the meaning is preserved.

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that the gate will never open without payment.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold says: always, if payment is not made then the gate is not open (gate may open when paid). Prediction says: always gate is never open and payment holds (or paid holds globally), which is much stronger and changes the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to ensure that always eventually position 2 or always eventually position 3.
The drone can guarantee that if the target is detected, then at the next step it will take a photo.
The swarm can guarantee that if a drone fails, then at the next step it will reconfigure the formation.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Swarm) and same temporal structure G(drone_failed -> X ...). Predicate 'reconfigured' is a clear shorthand/alias for 'formation_reconfigured' in context, preserving meaning.

detailed_results.input: The system and the user together can guarantee that sooner or later a good recommendation will be found.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition is the same set of agents (order irrelevant) and the temporal operator F matches 'sooner or later'; proposition matches.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that it will never cause a collision with a human.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold forbids collisions specifically with a human (!human_collision). Prediction forbids any collision (!collision), which is stronger and changes the expressed property.

detailed_results.input: Therefore, take me and bind me to the crosspiece half way up the mast; bind me as I stand upright, with a bond so fast that I cannot possibly break away, and lash the rope’s ends to the mast itself. If I beg and pray you to set me free, then bind me more tightly still.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition/agent is wrong (Captain vs Odysseus). The temporal/conditional content is lost: gold requires that whenever Odysseus is bound and praying/begging, the crew binds him more tightly; prediction is a tautology G(bonded -> bonded) and omits the praying condition and the bind_tightly outcome.

detailed_results.input: The warehouse and the courier together can guarantee that sooner or later the package will be shipped.
The robot number 1 does not have a strategy to ensure that position 3 will eventually hold when position 2 holds now.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states Robot1 lacks a strategy to ensure (pos2 -> eventually pos3) from the current state: !<<Robot1>>(pos2 -> F pos3). Prediction instead asserts Robot1 has a strategy to eventually reach a state where (pos2 -> eventually pos3) holds: <<Robot1>>F(pos2 -> F pos3). This flips the outer negation/ability and adds an extra eventuality, changing the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The security system can guarantee that unauthorized access will never occur.
The robots number 1 and number 2 do not  have a strategy to ensure that they will reach position 2 in the next step.
detailed_results.reasoning: The input/gold state that robots 1 and 2 do NOT have a strategy to ensure reaching pos2 next step, i.e., negation of the coalition ability. The prediction omits the leading negation and asserts they DO have such a strategy, reversing the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The drone can guarantee that if it enters return mode, then it will never land outside the base.
detailed_results.reasoning: Although the coalition and temporal structure match (global implication to a global safety property), the predicate in the consequent is changed: gold forbids the specific event/state 'landed_outside_base', while prediction forbids being 'outside_base' in general. This is a stronger/different property and not a clear alias.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to ensure that eventually reach position 1.
The robotic arm can guarantee that it will keep aligning until the object is aligned.
The robotic arm can guarantee that if the target position changes, then at the next step it will start replanning.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Arm) and same temporal structure G( p -> X q ). Predicate names are consistent paraphrases: target_changed ≈ target_position_changed and replanning ≈ replanning_started in the context of 'start replanning'.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to guarantee that it will eventually reach position 1 or position 2.
detailed_results.reasoning: In ATL/CTL-style semantics, F(pos1 || pos2) is equivalent to (F pos1 || F pos2): eventually reaching either position means either eventually reaching pos1 or eventually reaching pos2. Same agent and eventuality operator.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 2 and number 3 have a strategy to ensure that always not position 4.
The vehicle can guarantee that it will keep searching for parking until it finds a free spot.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Vehicle) and same until structure. Predicates 'searching' vs 'searching_parking' and 'free_parking' vs 'parking_found' are reasonable aliases for the described actions/conditions.

detailed_results.input: The logistics system and the courier together can guarantee that sooner or later the package will be delivered.
The security system can guarantee that it will keep monitoring until the threat is removed.
Nobody else could have got in this way, as this entrance was meant only for you [K.]. Now I'll go and close it.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states that agent K can eventually enter (<<K>>F enter). Prediction instead says K. can guarantee that globally no 'other_way' holds (<<K.>>G !other_way), which changes both the proposition and the temporal meaning (eventual entering vs always no other way).

detailed_results.input: The network system can guarantee that sooner or later the packet will be delivered.
The agricultural system can guarantee that if the soil is dry, then at the next step it will enable irrigation.
The robotic arm can guarantee that if the object is fragile, then it will never exceed a maximum force.
detailed_results.reasoning: Although the coalition and overall G(… -> G …) structure match, the atomic proposition in the safety condition is changed: gold requires never exceeding the maximum force (!force_over_limit), while the prediction states !max_force, which would mean the maximum force is never applied at all, not merely never exceeded. This is a semantic change.

detailed_results.input: The game system can guarantee that a critical bug will never occur.
